author: Ja'han Jones
title: In Trump’s honor, Arizona Republicans approve conspiracy-based election bills

sentence: The significance of the America First coalition’s parallel efforts can be seen clearly in Arizona, where the slate’s candidate is Mark Finchem, a former firefighter and real estate agent who has served in the state House since 2015 and has become the leading Republican contender for secretary of state.
title: Campaigning to Oversee Elections, While Denying the Last One

title: Campaigning to oversee elections, while denying the last one: Partisan candidates are transforming races for secretary of state

sentence: The bill already has 15 Republican co-sponsors, including state Rep. Mark Finchem, the Trump-endorsed secretary of state candidate seeking to take over the state's elections.
title: Arizona bills embrace Trump conspiracy theories — could allow GOP to reject election results

sentence: He was endorsing Mark Finchem, a Republican lawmaker from Tucson, in his bid to become Arizona’s secretary of state.

title: ‘This should terrify the nation’: the Trump ally seeking to run Arizona’s elections

title: A Trump-backed candidate in Arizona is trying to raise $750,000 for a legal defense fund after he was subpoenaed by the January 6 committee

sentence: Republican state Rep. Mark Finchem, who has promoted a host of QAnon conspiracies and introduced a resolution to decertify the 2020 presidential election in Arizona, attended the same protest.
title: The Arizona Republican Caught in a Vise by Trump’s Big Lie

sentence: Lawsuits seeking to disqualify Reps. Paul Gosar and Andy Biggs and state Rep. Mark Finchem filed on behalf of a handful of Arizona voters allege that they are ineligible to hold office because they participated in an insurrection.
